The module has detected a parameter assignment error. Parameter assignment errors include: - The module cannot evaluate parameters (examples for possible causes: unknown parameters, invalid parameter combination). - The module has not been assigned parameters yet. - The user calibration does not match the parameter assignment. - Calibration error Solution: Check the parameters and correct them. Then reload the parameters to the module.

Text.TextId: Sensor or load voltage missing - Help
Text.Value: There is no encoder or load supply voltage. Solution: Check the wiring of the encoder or load power supply. Correct the wiring error. Check to see if the power supply is switched on.
The module fuse has tripped. An overload occurred on the output signal path. Solution: Find out why the fuse was tripped. Correct the problem and replace the fuse.

A communication error has occurred. The possible causes depend on the module type your are using. Additional information is available in the module manual. Solution: The solution depends on the cause. Detailed information is available in the module manual.
The permitted common mode voltage on non-isolated channels was exceeded or an M wire break occurred on isolated channels. Solution: Check the wiring of the channels. Remedy the wiring error.
An error has occurred on the reference channel. Solution: Refer to the module manual.

The module signals that a hardware interrupt was lost. The hardware interrupt cannot be signaled because the previous interrupt was not acknowledged. There may be an error in the configuration. Solution: Change the interrupt behavior in the CPU. Change the parameter assignment of the module, if necessary. Note: The error will be pending until the module has received new parameters, for example, by restarting the module.
The actuator signals that a limit was exceeded, for example, the speed or the load current. Solution: Check the match between module and actuator.

The module has detected a problem with the actuator and has switched it off. Detailed information is available in the module manual. Possible causes: A circuit breaker was tripped due to a short-circuit, an asymmetry or a ground fault. A thermistor has triggered. Quick Stop. fail safe shutdown. Solution: Check the possible causes and eliminate the errors.
The module has detected a problem on the channel and has performed a fail safe shutdown. A discrepancy error may be one reason for the shutdown. Solution: Check the channel and remedy the cause.

The module has detected an external error at the process end. Possible causes: Encoder error / actuator error / encoder data is incorrect / Problem with change-over contact. Solution: Check the wiring. If necessary, replace the encoder or actuator.
The channel is temporarily unavailable. Solution: Refer to the module manual.
Current is flowing in the motor feeder, even though it is in test mode or in the test position. Possible causes: - The main circuit is not interrupted in test mode.

A limit for phase unbalance has been exceeded. - Phase unbalance can result in overload. Possible causes: - Failure of a phase - Fault in the motor winding Solution: Check the motor feeder and the motor.

The motor feeder is overloaded. The motor temperature has exceeded a limit. Solution: Check the motor and the applications driven by the motor. You can switch on the motor again after the cooling-off period has expired or after deleting the thermal motor model.
Parameters for Ex motor protection received. Solution: Confirm the correctness directly at the protection device or for the protection device.
The current has exceeded a limit. Solution: Check the application driven by the motor.
The current has undercut a limit. Solution: Check the application driven by the motor.
The maximum motor current has exceeded a limit for the stalled rotor protection. Possible causes: The motor is blocked. Solution: Check the application driven by the motor.
Unrecoverable error detected after internal diagnostics (self-test, contactor contacts, contact block, etc.). Solution: Replace the device.

Contact block (switch contact, power semiconductors) too hot Solution: - Check the ambient conditions associated with cooling. You may want to consider lowering the operating characteristics. - Check the number of starting operations.

Text.TextId: Supply voltage too low motor - Help
Text.Value: The supply voltage is below the permitted value. Solution: Check the power supply (load rating, voltage range).

Text.TextId: Power supply to switching element missing
Text.Value: Power supply to switching element missing

Text.TextId: Power supply to switching element missing - Help
Text.Value: No supply voltage detected. Solution: Check the power supply to the contact blocks and the cabling.

No current flow is detected for pending startup command in the motor feeder. Solution: - Check to see if the main circuit was interrupted (fuse, main switch). - Check to see if the motor contactor or contactor control is defective. - Check to see if load is missing.
The output driver for the sensor power supply is overloaded. Solution: Check the cabling and the sensor.

Module is not or incorrectly parameterized or parameterization changes are denied in current operating mode. Correct and execute parameterization Switch the operating mode and repeat parameterization.

The process image of the outputs (PIQ) contains invalid control bit combinations (e.g. control bits for clockwise and counter-clockwise rotation are set at the same time). Solution: Check and correct the process image of the outputs (PIQ).
The main power monitoring detects a phase failure.
There is a warning or shutdown signal at one input at least. Solution: Check the application.
The emergency end position has been exceeded. Solution: Check the sensors for the operation end position.
The emergency end position has been exceeded. Solution: Check the sensors for the operation end position.

Trip reset currently not possible (for example, because cooling period is active).
Solution: Repeat the action later (for example, at the end of the cooling period).

Text.TextId: Phase failure or fuse defective - Help
Text.Value: No current flow is detected for pending startup command in the motor feeder. Possible causes: Phase failure / fault in the motor winding / defective fuse / circuit breaker was tripped / load is missing Solution: Check motor and main feed-in / remove short-circuit / exchange defective fuse or device

The signal states of A and B must meet specific requirements for two-phase and three-phase incremental encoders. Solution: Correct the process wiring, check the encoders and the sensor, check the parameter assignment.
The module may only be operated within its specification. Solution: The encoder signal or the connected signals have a frequency, time period or speed that is too high.

Possible causes: Error at RS-422 connection / wire break / no encoder connected / cable is too long / short-circuit / overload / external voltage / overheating Solution: Correct the process wring, check the encoders and the sensor, check the parameter assignment.
An error has occurred at the SSI encoder connection (SSI frame error). Start error / Stop error / Parity error / Monoflop time error Solution: Correct the configuration.
An error has occurred at the BISS encoder connection (BISS frame error). Solution: Correct the configuration.
Wire break digital input (A, B or N)
The wiring is faulty. Solution: Correct the process wiring, check the encoders and the sensor, check the parameter assignment.
The output stage is overloaded and gets too hot. Solution: Match load and output stage.
Station stop - Module parameter <potential group> incorrect or wrong BaseUnit/TerminalBlock on real configuration slot {1:d}
Check for suitable base unit or terminal block
Station stop - missing or wrong server module
Check that the server module is installed correctly in the rack
Station stop - too many missing modules ({1:d})
Check for pulled module, only one pulled module allowed

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1688 Permitted size of back plan exceeded
EXT_CHN_DIAG_1688_HELP Permitted size of back plan exceeded
Text.Value: Check backplane mounting for valid mechanical size

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1692 Invalid bus adapter at interface module
Text.Value: Invalid bus adapter at interface module

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1692_HELP Invalid bus adapter at interface module
Text.Value: Check project planning and mounting for the right bus adapter
Check that the server module is installed correctly in the rack.
Module parameter <potential group> incorrect or wrong BaseUnit / TerminalBlock on real configuration slot <slot number>
Check for suitable base unit or terminal block
Missing voltage in load group at slot according channel number
Check the load supply voltage of modules
The supply voltage is below the tolerance limit. Check the power supply
There is a problem which may lead to redundancy loss. Please execute a maintenance cycle as described in the manual.
There is a problem with the power supply which may lead to redundancy loss. Please execute a maintenance cycle as described in the manual.
Failure in bus adapter of partner module
Replace bus adapter of partner module.
Redundancy partner with different hardware or software version
Hardware / firmware version of the redundancy partners are different. Solution: Replace module or perform firmware update.

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1760 access error to remanence memory Base Unit
Text.Value: Failure on access of flash memory in base unit

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1760_HELP access error to remanence memory Base Unit
Text.Value: Check if the base unit is mounted correctly into the rack or replace base unit.

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1761 access error to remanence memory bus adapter
Text.Value: Failure on access of flash memory in bus adapter

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1761_HELP access error to remanence memory bus adapter
Text.Value: Check if the bus adapter is mounted correctly into the module or replace bus adapter.

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1762 threshold for utilization of dynamic memory exceeded
Text.Value: warning: threshold for utilization of dynamic memory exceeded

Text.TextId: EXT_CHN_DIAG_1762_HELP threshold for utilization of dynamic memory exceeded
Text.Value: warning: threshold for utilization of dynamic memory exceeded
The PROFIsafe driver has detected a different destination address. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver and the address setting of the fail safe module.
The PROFIsafe driver has detected a prohibited destination address. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.
The PROFIsafe driver has detected a prohibited or different source address. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.

Text.TextId: Safety watchdog time value is 0 ms (F_WD_Time or F_WD_Time2
Text.Value: Safety watchdog time value is 0 ms (F_WD_Time)

Text.TextId: Help_Safety watchdog time value is 0 ms (F_WD_Time or F_WD_Time2
Text.Value: The PROFIsafe driver has detected an invalid watchdog time. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.

Text.TextId: Parameter F_SIL exceeds SIL from specific device application
Text.Value: Parameter F_SIL exceeds SIL from specific device application

Text.TextId: Help_Parameter F_SIL exceeds SIL from specific device application
Text.Value: The PROFIsafe driver has detected a discrepancy between the SIL setting of the communication and the application. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.

Text.TextId: Parameter F_CRC_Length does not match the generated value
Text.Value: Parameter F_CRC_Length does not match the generated values

Text.TextId: Help_Parameter F_CRC_Length does not match the generated value
Text.Value: The PROFIsafe driver has detected a discrepancy in the CRC length. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.

Text.TextId: Version of F-Parameter set or F_Block_ID incorrect
Text.Value: Version of F parameter set incorrect

Text.TextId: Help_Version of F-Parameter set or F_Block_ID incorrect
Text.Value: The PROFIsafe driver has detected invalid fail safe parameters version. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.
The PROFIsafe driver has received inconsistent fail safe parameters. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.

Text.TextId: Device specific diagnostic information, see manual
Help_Device specific diagnostic information, see manual
Text.Value: Module-specific diagnostic information detected. Solution: Refer to the module manual.
The iPar server does not respond with Save
The iPar server does not respond with Restore
The PROFIsafe driver has detected inconsistent i-parameters. Solution: Check the parameter assignment.
F_Block_ID not supported Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the PROFIsafe driver.
Module is defective. Solution: Replace the module or send it in.

Short-circuit to P potential Possible causes: - The encoder cable has a short-circuit to the P potential. - The output cable has a short-circuit to the P potential. Solution: Correct the process wiring.

Short-circuit to M Possible causes: - The encoder cable has a short-circuit to the M potential. - The output cable has a short-circuit to the M potential. - The output cable has a short-circuit after ground Solution: Correct the process wiring.
Error in encoder supply Possible causes: Polarity reversal /undervoltage / wire break Solution: Check the front connector or correct the process wiring.

Text.TextId: Falsche/inkonsistente Firmware vorhanden. Firmware update erforderlich
Help_Falsche/inkonsistente Firmware vorhanden. Firmware update erforderlich
Text.Value: The firmware is incomplete and/or the firmware expansions are incomplete or incompatible. Solution: Run a complete firmware update. Check any occurring error messages. Check to see whether or not the firmware update was aborted.
Redundancy partner has different hardware/firmware version
HW/ FW version of redundant IO modules are inconsistent. Solution: Replace module or update firmware.
IO modules are not redundant. Solution: Refer to the module manual
Output switch-off via push-button Solution: Pull of module permissable
Parametrization of redundant IO modules is inconsistent. Solution: Check module parametrization
Short circuit/wire break of sensor cable
Please check cables of sensor regarding wire break or short circuit
Possible causes: Short circuit or wire break of the encoder cable Solution: Check the wiring, change the encoder
Check the wiring of the partner channel

Text.TextId: Kurzschluss oder Ueberlast der Externen Geberversorgung
Text.Value: Short circuit / overload of the sensor supply voltage

Text.TextId: Help_Kurzschluss oder Ueberlast der Externen Geberversorgung
Text.Value: Error in the external auxiliary supply Possible causes: - Short circuit - Overload Solution: Correct the process wiring.
Problem at digital outputs of module Possible causes: - Short-circuit / Overload / external infeed Solution: Correct the wiring of the digital outputs of the module.
The module has detected an error in a HART parameter data record. Solution: Check and correct the HART-specific parameters.
A communication error occurred between the module and the HART field device. Solution: Check the field device and the connection to the field device.
HART primary variable out of range

The HART main variable is outside of the limits configured in the field device. Solution: Correct the violation of the high and low measuring range limit and check the setting of the HART field device limits.
The analog output current is outside the permitted range. Solution: Correct the violation of the high and low measuring range limit.
HART output current of the field device fixed

The field device delivers a fixed amperage. The field device is in multidrop mode or the field device is configured to a fixed value for testing. Solution: Check the parameter assignment of the field device.
The field device provides more status information.
The field device reports a configuration change. The measurement results may be corrupt.
The field device reports a malfunction. The measurement results may be corrupt.
HART - non primary variable out of limits

At least one of the HART auxiliary variables is outside of the limits configured in the field device. Solution: Correct the violation of the high and low limit of the measuring range and check the limit setting of the HART field device.
Carrier module or memory in carrier module is defective
Carrier module is defective. Solution: Exchange carrier module.
Terminal block (TB) or memory in terminal block is defective
Terminal block is defective. Solution: Exchange Terminal block.
Bus Adapter (BA) is defective Solution: Exchange Bus Adapter

An error occurred during the positioning process. A possible cause may be: - a limit switch has been activated during positioning. - the traversing range has been exceeded during positioning.
- a movement instruction into positive direction has been started and the positive limit switch is active. - a movement instruction into negative direction has been started and the negative limit switch is active

The power stage has reported an error. A possible cause may be: - the shutdown temperature has been reached. - the power stage driver doesn't respond because of a defect. the module is configured for the power stage operation mode but it is only supplied via the supply pins for the indexer operation mode. - the supply voltage is too low. The power stage has been deactivated for self-protection.
An internal error has occurred. Replace the module, if the error persists.
A running job has been cancelled because the DIS input of the module has been activated.

Text.TextId: Internal sensor supply shorted to P
Text.Value: Internal sensor supply short-circuit to P

Text.TextId: Help_Internal sensor supply shorted to P
Text.Value: Possible causes: Short-circuit of internal encoder supply after P / short-circuit of two encoder supplies / The capacity of the connected encoder is too high for the configured test time. Solution: Check the configured test time and the process wiring.

Text.TextId: Overload or Internal sensor supply shorted to M
Text.Value: Short-circuit or overload of the digital output or the supply outputs of the encoder / The ambient temperature is not within the specification. Solution: Correct the process wiring. Improve the cooling, check the connected consumers.

Text.TextId: Help_Overload or Internal sensor supply shorted to M
Text.Value: The internal encoder supply is overloaded. Solution: Eliminate the short-circuit in the process wiring.
A channel error was detected. Confirmation is required to enable the channel. Solution: Confirm the channel error.
No access to the F-address stored in the retentive memory. Solution: Check to see if the memory exists or replace it, if necessary.

No valid F-address stored in the retentive memory. Possible causes: First commissioning / Deliberate change of the F-address parameters / Deviation between expected and actual configuration of the plant Solution: Perform the F-address assignment for commissioning or when you deliberately change the parameters. Check the consistency between the required and actual configuration.

Chatter monitoring is a process control function for digital input signals. It detects and signals unusual process-related signal trends, such as frequent fluctuations in the input signal between "0" and "1". Solution: Check the parameters for chatter monitoring. Check the process wiring and the encoder. Use the parameter assignment to specify the operating mode of chatter monitoring. Refer to the module manual.
The maximum switching frequency of the module has been exceeded. Solution: Reduce the switching frequency.
The low limit of the minimum temperature permitted has been violated. Solution: Operate the module in the specified range.
The module has detected an internal error. Possible causes: Increased EMC interference / module is defective. Solution: Replace the module if the error continues.

The discrepancy time set for two-channel mode in the digital input pair of the module has been exceeded. Possible causes of the discrepancy error: - Incorrect parameter assignment, short-circuit of the disconnected encoder cable / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / wire break of the encoder supply cable / encoder error Solution: Check the discrepancy time, the encoders and their wiring.

Text.TextId: Relay can not be turned on
Text.Value: Relay can not be turned on

Text.TextId: Help_Relay can not be turned on
Text.Value: The module has detected an internal error. Solution: Replace the module.

Text.TextId: Relay can not be turned off (contacts welded)
Text.Value: Relay can not be turned off (contacts welded)

Text.TextId: Help_Relay can not be turned off (contacts welded)
Text.Value: The module has detected an internal error. Solution: Replace the module.

The PROFIsafe driver has detected a timeout. Possible causes: The time interval for the PROFIsafe timeout is set incorrectly. Bus error Solution: Check the parameter assignment. Make sure that the communication works correctly.
The PROFIsafe driver has detected a CRC error. Possible causes: - Bus error Solution: Make sure that your communication is working correctly.
The input signal has a short-circuit to P. Solution: Check the cabling.
The module has detected an internal error. Possible cause: The module is defective. Solution: Replace the module.
The module has detected an internal error. Possible causes: - Increased EMC interference, module is defective. Solution: Replace the module if the error continues.
The maximum permitted output current has been exceeded, but the output stage has not been switched off. Possible causes: - Short-circuit Solution: Check the cabling.
The supply voltage is too high. Solution: Check the supply voltage. .
The supply voltage is too low. Solution: Check the supply voltage.

The AS-i master can no longer access an AS-i slave. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with standard address or with address extension A). Possible causes: Defective slave / wire break Solution: Check the connection cables and the readiness for operation of the slave.

The AS-i master can no longer access an AS-i slave at a B address. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with address extension B). Possible causes: Defective slave / wire break Solution: Check the connection cables and the readiness for operation of the slave.

An AS-i slave signals an I/O error. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with standard address or with address extension A). Possible causes: Overload of an output or other product-specific cause. Solution: Refer to the manual of the affected slave.
Periphery error in AS-i slave on B-address

Text.TextId: AS-i B Slave Periphery Fault - Help
Text.Value: An AS-i A/B slave at a B address signals an I/O error. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with address extension B). Solution: Refer to the manual of the affected slave.

Several AS-i slaves signal the same AS-i slave address. Communication with these slaves is therefore not possible. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with standard address or with address extension A). Solution: Change the AS-i slave addresses so that the addresses are unique in the network.

Several AS-i slaves at a B address signal the same AS-i slave address. Communication with these slaves is therefore not possible. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with address extension B). Solution: Change the AS-i slave addresses so that the addresses are unique in the network.
No voltage or too low voltage on AS-interface cable

Text.TextId: No voltage on AS-i cable - Help
Text.Value: The AS-i master has detected a voltage that is too low on the AS-i cable. Data exchange on the AS-Interface was stopped. Solution: Check the voltage and the polarity on the AS-i cable. Check the power supply for overload.

The actual configuration of the AS-i slaves on the AS-i cable has been determined to be different to the expected configuration saved in the AS-i master. Solution: In the case of brief failures, check for strong electromagnetic interfering signals on the AS-i installation, and remove the interfering influences. Ensure that the functional ground connection on the AS-i power supply / AS-i data decoupling unit is connected to the ground potential. Check for AS-i slave failure, overload, supernumerary slaves, incorrect addresses, incorrect slave types and EMC measures.
Short-circuit to ground on AS-interface line

Text.TextId: Ground fault on AS-i cable - Help
Text.Value: A ground fault has been detected between ASI+ and the ground potential, or between ASI- and the ground potential. A ground fault can cause communication issues and result in slave failure / configuration errors. A ground fault must be rectified in order to exclude the possibility of secondary faults. Solution: Check for insulation errors on the AS-i cable and sensor/actuator cables.

An AS-i slave was detected that is not in the expected configuration. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with standard address or with address extension A). Solution: Adjust the expected configuration in the AS-i master or remove the AS-i slave.

Text.TextId: supernumerary as-i slave on b-address error
supernumerary as-i slave on b-address error - help
Text.Value: An AS-i slave at a B address was detected that is not in the expected configuration. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with address extension B). Solution: Adjust the expected configuration in the AS-i master or remove the AS-i slave.

An AS-i slave was detected whose profile codes (IO, ID, ID2) or ID1 code do not correspond with the expected configuration. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with standard address or with address extension A). Solution: Use correct slave type, set ID1 code on the slave as in the expected configuration.

Text.TextId: incorrect as-i slave on b-address - help
Text.Value: An AS-i slave at a B address was detected whose profile codes (IO, ID, ID2) or ID1 code do not correspond with the expected configuration. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave (with address extension B). Solution: Use correct slave type, set ID1 code on the slave as in the expected configuration.
The voltage on the AS-i cable is too high. Solution: - Check the voltage on the AS-i cable.
The voltage on the AS-i cable is too low or missing. Solution: - Check the voltage and the polarity on the AS-i cable. - Check the connection of the module to the AS-i cable.

The discrepancy time set for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has been exceeded. The channel state was 0/0 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / wire break of the encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the discrepancy time.

The discrepancy time set for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has been exceeded. The channel state was 0/1 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / wire break of the encoder cable / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the discrepancy time. Channel state 0/0 is required before switching-on again.

The discrepancy time set for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has been exceeded. The channel state was 1/0 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / wire break of the encoder cable / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the discrepancy time. Channel state 0/0 is required before switching-on again.

The discrepancy time set for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has been exceeded. The channel state was 1/1 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the discrepancy time.

The sequence monitoring condition for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has not been fulfilled. The channel state was 0/0 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / wire break of the encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the sequence monitoring condition.

The sequence monitoring condition for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has not been fulfilled. The channel state was 0/1 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / wire break of the encoder cable / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the sequence monitoring condition. Channel state 0/0 is required before switching-on again.

The sequence monitoring condition for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has not been fulfilled. The channel state was 1/0 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / wire break of the encoder cable / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the sequence monitoring condition. Channel state 0/0 is required before switching-on again.

The sequence monitoring condition for two-channel operation at the digital input pair of an AS-i safety slave has not been fulfilled. The channel state was 1/1 when the error was detected. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Sensor error / short-circuit of the connected encoder cable / incorrect parameter assignment. Solution: Check the sensors and their wiring. Check the sequence monitoring condition. Channel state 0/0 is required before switching-on again.
The maximum permissible temperature was exceeded. Solution: Check the ambient conditions. Operate the module within its specified temperature range.

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1050 Safe AS-i input slave missing
CHN_DIAG_1050_HELP Safe AS-i input slave missing
Text.Value: A safety-related AS-i input slave is missing. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Failure of the slave / wrong slave type / wrong configuration of the AS-i master. Solution: Check the operability of the slave. Use a safety-related input slave. Check the configuration and function of the AS-i master.

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1051 Safe AS-i output slave failed
CHN_DIAG_1051_HELP Safe AS-i output slave failed
Text.Value: A safety-related AS-i output cannot be controlled. The safety-related AS-i slave of the control unit is missing. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: The AS-i slave is not included in the configuration of the AS-i master. Solution: Insert the AS-i address of the control unit into the configuration of the AS-i master. The control unit owns the slave profile codes IO.ID.ID2 = 6.B.D and ID1 code = 0.

A safety-related AS-i slave provides inconsistent signals. The transferred AS-i safety code sequence does not correspond to the stored code sequence in the memory. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Cross-circuit in the sensor circuit / short-time opening or closing of sensor contacts / wiring errors in the sensor circuit. Solution: Check the wiring. Check the contacts in the sensor circuit.

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1055 AS-i safety slave code sequence ready to save
Text.Value: AS-i safety slave code sequence ready to save

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1055_HELP AS-i safety slave code sequence ready to save
Text.Value: A safety-related AS-i slave provides a new AS-i safety code sequence to be saved in the non-volatile memory. The safety-related signal will be available for processing after saving. Possible causes: A new AS-i safety slave has been installed. Solution: Conform the saving of the code sequences in STEP 7 online, or press the button for this intended purpose.

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1056 AS-i safety slave code sequence missing
Text.Value: AS-i safety slave code sequence missing

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1056_HELP AS-i safety slave code sequence missing
Text.Value: For a safety-related AS-i slave, the AS-i safety code sequence is not published to the system. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: A new AS-i safety slave has been installed. The contacts in the sensor circuit are open. Solution: Close both contacts in the sensor circuit of the slave, or switch the sensor to state "1".

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1057 AS-i safety slave code sequence multiple used
Text.Value: AS-i safety slave code sequence multiple used

Text.TextId: CHN_DIAG_1057_HELP AS-i safety slave code sequence multiple used
Text.Value: Several safety-related AS-i slaves transfer the same AS-i safety code sequence. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave). Solution: Repace safety-related AS-i slave so that the AS-i safety code sequences are unique in the network.

A safety-related AS-i slave provides invalid signals. The transferred AS-i safety code sequence contains interferences. The channel number of the alarm is the AS-i address of the affected slave. Possible causes: Interference signals in the sensor circuit / faulty AS-i slave. Solution: Check the wiring. Replace the AS-i slave.
Unrecoverable error detected after internal diagnostics (self-test). Solution: Cycle the AS-i voltage and operating voltage, or replace the device.

Text.TextId: Burkert_Pilot valve: switching cycle counter limit reached
Text.Value: Pilot valve: switching cycle counter limit reached

Text.TextId: Burkert_Info_Pilot valve: switching cycle counter limit reached
Text.Value: The switching cycle warning limit of the pilot valve has been reached. Remedy: replace pilot valve and reset switching cycle counter.

Text.TextId: Burkert_Actuator: switching cycle counter limit reached
Text.Value: Actuator: switching cycle counter limit reached

Text.TextId: Burkert_Info_Actuator: switching cycle counter limit reached
Text.Value: The switching cycle warning limit of the actuator has been reached. Remedy: Maintain actuator and reset switching cycle counter.
The external valve voltage cut-off is active or internal module fault. Remedy: For EVS modules, check the EVS voltage connection, replace the module.
Pilot valve not correctly fitted or faulty. Remedy: Check that the pilot valve has been fitted correctly, replace if necessary.
Pilot valve not correctly fitted or faulty. Remedy: Check that the pilot valve has been fitted correctly, replace if necessary.
Pressure sensor is faulty. Remedy: Replace module
The limit value for monitoring the pressure was exceeded. Remedy: Check pressure supply or adjust limit value
The limit value for monitoring the pressure was not reached. Remedy: Check pressure supply or adjust limit value.
Will only be generated if parameterized.

internal reference temperature from base unit

Station stop: Incorrect 'Potential group' module parameter or wrong BaseUnit at real slot

Enable generation of diagnosis: Short circuit to L+
Enable generation of diagnosis: Wire break

Base unit is defective. Solution: Exchange base unit.

Text.TextId: Between comparison value and high counting limit
Text.Value: Between comparison value and high limit

Text.TextId: Between comparison value and low counting limit
Text.Value: Between comparison value and low limit
Transmission error: data inconsistent (CRC2 error). Solution: Refer to the system manual.

Text.TextId: Transmission error: Timeout (watchdog time 1 or 2 expired)
Text.Value: Transmission error: Timeout (watchdog time 1 or 2 expired)

Text.TextId: Help_Transmission error: Timeout (watchdog time 1 or 2 expired)
Text.Value: Transmission error: timeout (F_WD_Time or F_WD_Time_2 elapsed). Solution: Check F_WD_Time and fieldbus timings

Diagnostic queue overflow. Not all pending diagnostic messages could be transferred. The module may remain deactivated until the power is cycled. Solution: Correct the errors reported prior to this message.
The terminal block cannot be used with the current module. Replace terminal block.
The module has detected an internal error. Possible causes: Increased EMC interference / module is defective. Solution: Replace the module if the error continues.
The supply voltage is too high. Solution: Check the supply voltage.
Ambient temperature violates the high/low warning limits.
Ambient temperature violates the high/low alarm limits.
Ambient humidity violates the high warning limit.
Ambient humidity violates the high alarm limit.
Check the installation location and the ambient temperature of the CFU.
The functionality of the CFU is no longer ensured. Check the installation location and the ambient temperature of the CFU.
Check the installation location and the ambient humidity of the CFU

Interface mit PROFINET Schnittstelle V2.3 (RT) mit Zykluszeit ab 250 Mikrosekunden; Medienredundanz (MRP); singuläre Systemredundanz NAP: S2; Konfigurationsänderungen im Betrieb; Prozessschnittstellen: 16x DI/DQ/AI/AQ mit HART (frei konfigurierbar); Firmware V1.0
PROFINET-Adapter mit 1 LC Glasfaser-Anschluss und 1 RJ45 Ethernet-Anschluss
PROFINET-Adapter mit 1 LC Glasfaser-Anschluss und 1 Fast Connect Ethernet-Anschluss
Reset-Taster des Moduls nicht nach dessen Start deaktivieren
ERTEC: Summe aller über SPI empfangenen Telegramme
ERTEC: Summe aller beschädigten Telegramme über SPI
FPGA: Summe aller über SPI empfangenen Telegramme
FPGA: Summe aller beschädigten Telegramme über SPI
Virtuelle Elemente werden nur zur Entwicklung verwendet
Aktiviert die Überwachung auf Kurzschluss nach M
Aktiviert die Überwachung auf Kurzschluss nach L+

Das Modul hat einen Parametrierfehler erkannt. Parametrierfehler umfassen: - Das Modul kann keine Parameter auswerten (Beispiele für mögliche Ursachen: unbekannte Parameter, ungültige Parameterkombination). - Dem Modul wurden noch keine Parameter zugewiesen. - Die Kalibrierung durch den Anwender stimmt nicht mit der Parametrierung überein. - Kalibrierfehler Abhilfe: Parameter prüfen und korrigieren. Anschließend Parameter wieder in Modul laden.

Text.TextId: Sensor or load voltage missing - Help
Text.Value: Keine Geber- oder Lastspannungsversorgung. Abhilfe: Verdrahtung der Geber- oder Lastspannungsversorgung überprüfen. Verdrahtungsfehler beseitigen. Prüfen, ob Spannungsversorgung eingeschaltet ist.
Die Sicherung des Moduls hat ausgelöst. Am Ausgangssignalpfad ist eine Überlast aufgetreten. Abhilfe: Ursache für das Auslösen der Sicherung ermitteln. Problem beheben und Sicherung austauschen.

Ein Kommunikationsfehler ist aufgetreten. Die möglichen Ursachen sind vom verwendeten Modultyp abhängig. Weitere Informationen finden Sie im Modul-Handbuch. Abhilfe: Die Abhilfe ist von der Ursache abhängig. Ausführliche Informationen sind dem Modul-Handbuch zu entnehmen.

Die zulässige Gleichtaktspannung wurde an potenzialgebundenen Kanälen überschritten oder an potenzialgetrennten Kanälen ist ein M-Drahtbruch aufgetreten. Abhilfe: Verdrahtung der Kanäle überprüfen. Verdrahtungsfehler beheben.
Am Referenzkanal ist ein Fehler aufgetreten. Abhilfe: Siehe Modul-Handbuch.

Das Modul meldet einen verlorenen Hardware-Interrupt. Der Hardware-Interrupt kann nicht gemeldet werden, weil der vorherige Interrupt nicht quittiert wurde. Möglicherweise ist die Konfiguration fehlerhaft. Abhilfe: Interrupt-Verhalten in der CPU ändern. Gegebenenfalls Parametrierung des Moduls ändern. Hinweis: Der Fehler liegt an, bis das Modul, beispielsweise durch einen Modul-Neustart, neue Parameter empfangen hat.
Der Aktor meldet die Überschreitung eines Grenzwerts für beispielsweise Geschwindigkeit oder Laststrom. Abhilfe: Übereinstimmung von Modul und Aktor prüfen.

Das Modul hat ein Problem mit dem Aktor entdeckt und diesen abgeschaltet. Ausführliche Informationen sind dem Modul-Handbuch zu entnehmen. Mögliche Ursachen: Auslösen eines Leistungsschalters wegen Kurzschluss, Unsymmetrie oder Erdschluss. Auslösen eines Thermistors. Quick-Stop. Sicherheitsgerichtete Abschaltung. Abhilfe: Mögliche Ursachen prüfen und Fehler beseitigen.

Das Modul hat ein Problem am Kanal entdeckt und eine fehlersichere Abschaltung durchgeführt. Eine mögliche Ursache für die Abschaltung ist ein Diskrepanzfehler. Abhilfe: Kanal überprüfen und Ursache beseitigen.

Das Modul hat prozessseitig einen externen Fehler erkannt. Mögliche Ursachen: Geberfehler / Aktorfehler / Geberdaten fehlerhaft / Problem mit Wechselkontakt. Abhilfe: Verdrahtung überprüfen. Gegebenenfalls Geber oder Aktor austauschen.
Der Kanal ist vorübergehend nicht verfügbar. Abhilfe: Siehe Modul-Handbuch.
Im Motorabzweig fließt Strom, obwohl dieser sich im Testbetrieb bzw. in der Testposition befindet. Mögliche Ursachen: - Der Hauptstromkreis ist im Testbetrieb nicht unterbrochen.

Ein Grenzwert für die Phasenunsymmetrie wurde überschritten.. - Die Phasenunsymmetrie kann zu einer Überlastung führen. Mögliche Ursachen: - Ausfall einer Phase - Fehler in der Motorwicklung Abhilfe: Motorabzweig und Motor überprüfen.

Der Motorabzweig wurde überlastet. Die Motortemperatur hat einen Grenzwert überschritten. Abhilfe: Motor und vom Motor angetriebene Applikationen überprüfen. Der Motor kann nach Ablauf der Abkühlzeit oder nach Löschung des thermischen Motormodells wieder eingeschaltet werden.
Parameter für den Ex-Motorschutz wurden empfangen. Abhilfe: Richtigkeit direkt am oder für das Schutzgerät bestätigen.
Der Strom hat einen Grenzwert überschritten. Abhilfe: Vom Motor angetriebene Applikation überprüfen.
Der Strom hat einen Grenzwert unterschritten. Abhilfe: Vom Motor angetriebene Applikation überprüfen.
Der maximale Motorstrom hat einen Grenzwert für den Blockierschutz überschritten. Mögliche Ursachen: Der Motor ist blockiert. Abhilfe: Vom Motor angetriebene Applikation überprüfen.
Nicht behebbarer Fehler nach Eigendiagnose (Selbsttest, Schützkontakte, Schaltelement usw.) erkannt. Abhilfe: Gerät austauschen.

Schaltelement (Schaltkontakt, Leistungshalbleiter) zu heiß Abhilfe: - Mit der Kühlung zusammenhängende Umgebungsbedingungen überprüfen. Möglicherweise Herabsetzung der Betriebswerte in Betracht ziehen. - Anzahl der Schaltvorgänge prüfen.

Text.TextId: Supply voltage too low motor - Help
Text.Value: Die Versorgungsspannung liegt unterhalb des zulässigen Werts. Abhilfe: Stromversorgung überprüfen (Lastbemessung Spannungsbereich).

Text.TextId: Power supply to switching element missing
Power supply to switching element missing - Help
Text.Value: Keine Versorgungsspannung erkannt. Abhilfe: Stromversorgung zu den Schaltelementen und Verkabelung überprüfen.

Für einen anstehenden Anlaufbefehl im Motorabzweig wird kein Stromfluss erkannt. Abhilfe: - Prüfen, ob der Hauptstromkreis unterbrochen wurde (Sicherung, Hauptschalter). - Prüfen, ob das Motorschütz oder die Schützansteuerung defekt ist. - Prüfen, ob die Last fehlt.
Der Ausgangstreiber für die Sensorversorgung ist überlastet. Abhilfe: Verkabelung und Sensor überprüfen.

Das Modul ist nicht bzw. fehlerhaft parametriert oder die Parameteränderungen werden in der aktuellen Betriebsart abgelehnt. Parameter korrigieren und Parametrierung vornehmen Betriebsart wechseln und Parametrierung wiederholen.

Das Prozessabbild der Ausgänge (PAA) enthält unzulässige Steuerbit-Kombinationen (z. B. Steuerbits für Rechtslauf und Linkslauf gleichzeitig gesetzt). Abhilfe: Prozessabbild der Ausgänge (PAA) überprüfen und korrigieren.
Die Hauptenergieüberwachung hat einen Phasenausfall erkannt.
An mindestens einem Eingang liegt ein Warn- bzw. Abschaltsignal an. Abhilfe: Applikation überprüfen.
Die Notendlage wurde überfahren. Abhilfe: Sensoren auf Betriebsendlage überprüfen.
Die Notendlage wurde überfahren. Abhilfe: Sensoren auf Betriebsendlage überprüfen.

Trip-Reset zurzeit nicht möglich (z. B. weil die Abkühlphase läuft).
Abhilfe: Aktion später wiederholen (z. B. nach dem Ablauf der Abkühlzeit).

Text.TextId: Phase failure or fuse defective - Help
Text.Value: Bei anstehendem Anlaufbefehl wird im Motorabzweig kein Stromfluss erkannt. Mögliche Ursachen: Phasenausfall / Fehler in der Motorwicklung / defekte Sicherung / Leistungsschalter hat ausgelöst / Last fehlt Abhilfe: Motorabzweig und Haupteinspeisung überprüfen / Kurzschluss beseitigen / defekte Sicherung oder Gerät austauschen

Die Signalzustände von A und B müssen bei zwei- und dreiphasigen Inkrementalgebern bestimmte Anforderungen erfüllen. Abhilfe: Prozessverdrahtung korrigieren, Geber und Sensor überprüfen, Parametrierung überprüfen.
Das Modul darf nur innerhalb der Spezifikation betrieben werden. Abhilfe: Frequenz, Dauer oder Geschwindigkeit des Gebersignals bzw. der angeschlossenen Signale zu hoch.

Mögliche Ursachen: Fehler am RS-422-Anschluss / Drahtbruch / kein Geber angeschlossen / Kabel zu lang / Kurzschluss / Überlast / externe Spannung / Überhitzung Abhilfe: Prozessverdrahtung korrigieren, Geber und Sensor überprüfen, Parameterzuweisung überprüfen.
Am SSI-Geberanschluss ist ein Fehler aufgetreten (SSI-Telegrammfehler). Startfehler / Stoppfehler / Paritätsfehler / Monoflopzeitfehler Abhilfe: Konfiguration korrigieren.
Am BiSS-Geberanschluss ist ein Fehler aufgetreten (BiSS-Telegrammfehler). Abhilfe: Konfiguration korrigieren.
Drahtbruch digitaler Eingang (A, B oder N)
Fehlerhafte Verdrahtung. Abhilfe: Prozessverdrahtung korrigieren, Geber und Sensor überprüfen, Parametrierung überprüfen.
Die Ausgangsstufe ist überlastet und wird zu heiß. Abhilfe: Last und Ausgangsstufe aufeinander abstimmen.
Stationsstopp - Modulparameter <Potenzialgruppe> fehlerhaft oder falsche BaseUnit bzw. falscher TerminalBlock auf realem Konfigurationssteckplatz {1:d}
Auf Eignung von Base Unit oder Terminalblock überprüfen

Text.Value: Rückwandbusaufbau auf zulässige mechanische Größe prüfen

Es liegt ein Problem mit der Spannungsversorgung vor, das zu einem Redundanzverlust führen kann. Wartung wie im Handbuch angegeben durchführen.

F_Block_ID wird nicht unterstützt Abhilfe: Parametrierung des PROFIsafe-Treibers überprüfen.
Modul ist defekt. Abhilfe: Modul austauschen oder einschicken.
Kurzschluss nach P Mögliche Ursachen: - Kurzschluss des Geberkabels nach P. - Kurzschluss des Ausgangskabels nach P. Abhilfe: Prozessverdrahtung korrigieren.
Kurzschluss nach M Mögliche Ursachen: - Kurzschluss des Geberkabels nach M. - Kurzschluss des Ausgangskabels nach M. - Kurzschluss des Ausgangskabels nach M. Abhilfe: Prozessverdrahtung korrigieren.
Fehler bei der Geberversorgung Mögliche Ursachen: Verpolung / Unterspannung / Drahtbruch Abhilfe: Frontstecker überprüfen oder Prozessverdrahtung korrigieren.

Text.TextId: Falsche/inkonsistente Firmware vorhanden. Firmware update erforderlich
Help_Falsche/inkonsistente Firmware vorhanden. Firmware update erforderlich
Text.Value: Die Firmware ist unvollständig und/oder die Firmware-Erweiterungen sind unvollständig oder passen nicht zueinander. Abhilfe: Vollständiges Firmware-Update durchführen. Etwaige Fehlermeldungen beachten. Überprüfen, ob das Firmware-Update abgebrochen wurde.
HW-/ FW-Version der redundanten Peripheriemodule ist inkonsistent. Abhilfe: Modul austauschen oder Firmware aktualisieren.
Peripheriemodule sind nicht redundant. Abhilfe: Siehe Modul-Handbuch
Abschaltung des Ausgangs über Taster Abhilfe: Ziehen des Moduls zulässig
Die Parametrierung der redundanten Peripheriemodule ist inkonsistent. Abhilfe: Parametrierung der Module überprüfen
